other_tests.findings: The proband was heterozygous for a novel C 3T mutation in the PPARG gene, leading to the substitution of arginine 194 by tryptophan (R194W), which was absent from 100 healthy Caucasians.
The R194W mutant did not bind DNA, demonstrating lack of transcriptional activity.
R194W mutant PPARγ was transcriptionally inactive, independent of cell type.
